description: From Latin recumbere, from re- (“back”) + cumbere (in comparative), akin to cubare (“to lie down”).

verbs.description: recumb (third-person singular simple present recumbs, present participle recumbing, simple past and past participle recumbed)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, intransitive) To lean; to recline; to repose.
examples: Of a faith, which consists in lolling, rolling, and recumbing upon Christ
